author: Amazon Customer

review: Bought this so I would have a device which supported a number of the streaming services I use. It was not as inexpensive as several other options, but had the best combination of technology and cost (caught it on sale for $84). I have it connected to my internet service by ethernet, use HDMI to deliver the picture to the TV and optical digital to send sound to the receiver (did not do thorough due diligence and thought it had coaxial digital, but was able to use a front input). It would be a nice feature to have a USB port for pictures.Very intuitive to set up and get started. The tiny remote could be easy to lose, but it is as simple as it can be. Good picture (I have 1080i, so must choose 720p) and surround sound. Don't use for gaming, just TV, music and pics.
